timeline.message:
Update policy-definitions.asciidoc

The docs show how to create an ILM policy, but not how to add the attr `node.attr.data: warm` (or hot).

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think this needs to be a note, just a regular paragraph. A little more explanation would be helpful. I'd show a single alternative and show the example inline, since it's not the main focus here:
This depends on hot and warm attributes specified in the node configurations. For example, to designate a node as a hot node, set node.attr.data: hot in elasticsearch.yml. For more information, see <>.
timeline.author: debadair

 }
 --------------------------------------------------

timeline.bodyText: One nit--should have a period at the end of the last sentence.
timeline.author: debadair
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -204,20 +204,7 @@ PUT _ilm/policy/my_policy
 }
 --------------------------------------------------
 
-NOTE: To add attributes `box_type` with values of `hot` and `warm` add lines to `elasticsearch.yaml`:
-
-[source,yaml]
---------------------------------------------------------
-node.attr.data: hot
-node.attr.data: warm
---------------------------------------------------------
-
-Or, instead set custom attributes when you start a node:
-
-[source,sh]
---------------------------------------------------------
-./bin/elasticsearch -Enode.attr.data=hot -Enode.attr.data=warm
---------------------------------------------------------
+This depends on `hot` and `warm` attributes specified in the node configurations. For example, to designate a node as a _hot_ node, set `node.attr.data: hot` in `elasticsearch.yml`. For more information, see <<index-allocation-filters>>

replies.bodyText: Thanks for catching that, fixed!  I will verify and merge.
